column4: hey, does someone know how if there is a difference in performance between using the nvidia.com grapic-drivers or the integrated nvidiadriver that comes with ubuntu??
has someone tried to install the nvidia.com grapic-driver in ubuntu?
has someone tried to install the nvidia.com grapic-driver in ubuntu?
yes.. had no problem with it
ok, so is there a difference between using the www.nvidia.com drivers and the integrated drivers coming from ubuntu?
i'm not really sure but i presume so
i just followed the howto on installing nvidia drivers
ok so you have actually done the things as configurating the kernel-headers and so...?
not sure whether the nvidia driver coming from the nvidia site is any more recent or improved but the one i tried from ubuntu worked fine
no.. nothing like that
you just installed the glx-drivers? and nothing more?
yeah, i think so
its just like that i have problems playing games using Cedega.... my gforce6800gt is pretty slow...
oh right.. i've got a tnt2-m64 :) anything is goign to be slow
apart from possibly asteroids
hmm, i think it has something to do with The Cedega program which cannot emulate things good enough-...
i dont 'know what cedega is.. sorry
ok, its just a program which makes you accesible to Games
